name: U.S. Assassination Attempts Multiple Choice Quiz | Criminals | 10 Questions

questions.text: What great human being was shot and killed by James Earl Ray?
questions.explanation:
Martin Luther King Jr.

	King was shot April 4, 1968, in Memphis, Tennessee.  He died the same day.

questions.text: In 1975, which U.S. President escaped an assassination attempt?
questions.explanation:
Gerald Ford.

	In Sacramento, California, Lynette 'Squeaky' Fromme pointed a .45 automatic at the President but never fired.  Two weeks later in San Francisco, another attempt was made by Sara Jane Moore, who fired one shot from a .38, but the bullet was deflected.

questions.text: Which Louisiana U.S. Senator was shot and killed in 1935?
questions.explanation:
Huey Long.

	Dr. Carl A. Weiss shot Long on September 8 in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.  He died two days later.

questions.text: Texas Governor John Connally was injured during which president's assassination?
questions.explanation:
John F. Kennedy

	Allegedly (most controversial) shot by Lee Harvey Oswald, Kennedy died November 22, 1963.  To add fuel to the controversy, Oswald was shot and killed two days later by Jack Ruby, who later died of cancer.

questions.text: Also known as El-Hajj Malik El-Shabazz, he was shot and killed in a New York City auditorium.  Who was he?
questions.explanation:
Malcolm X.

	Malcolm X was shot and killed on February 21, 1965.  The suspect/s were never identified.

questions.text: Which U.S. President was shot and killed by Leon Czolgosz?
questions.explanation:
William McKinley.

	McKinley was shot in Buffalo, New York, on September 6, 1901.  He died eight days later.

questions.text: An accomplice of John Wilkes Booth tried to kill which U.S. Secretary of State before the assassination of President Lincoln?
questions.explanation:
William Seward.

	On April 15, 1865, Lewis Powell (Paine) attempted to kill Seward in Washington.  He was linked to John Wilkes Booth who shot President Lincoln on the same day.  Seward survived the attempt, while Lincoln did not.

questions.text: Which civil rights leader was critically wounded, in an assassination attempt in 1980?
questions.explanation:
Vernon Jordan.

	Jordan was shot in an assassination attempt on May 29, in Fort Wayne, Indiana.

questions.text: Which of the following U.S. Presidents was shot in the left lung and survived?
questions.explanation:
Ronald Reagan.

	Reagan was shot by John Hinckley Jr. on March 30, 1981.  Three others were also wounded including James Brady.

questions.text: 1881 was a mournful year in the United States, that saw which U.S. President assassinated?
questions.explanation:
James Garfield.

	On July 2, Charles J. Guiteau shot Garfield in Washington DC.  Garfield died September 19, the same year that he took office.
